choices.C: Strict RPF checks only for the existence of at least one active route back to the source using the incoming interface.
choices.D: Strict RPF check is run on the first sent and reply packet of any new session.
choices.B: Strict RPF allows packets back to sources with all active routes.
choices.A: Strict RPF checks the best route back to the source using the incoming interface.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has configured a strict RPF check on FortiGate.

How does strict RPF check work?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
if the route is the best, traffic is allowed, if not, traffic is drop

Selected Answer: A
'strict' : a routing lookup (with best match) is made for the packet source IP. Packet is dropped if its ingressing interface does not match the interface selected by the routing lookup. https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Reverse-Path-Forwarding-RPF-implementation-and-use/ta-p/194382

Selected Answer: A
PÃ¡gina 86

Selected Answer: A
A correct one. I checked in an other comment B by error

Selected Answer: A
strict rfp checks the best route to the source

Selected Answer: A
strict rfp also checks the best route to the source

Selected Answer: B
B. Strict RPF allows packets back to sources with all active routes.

comments.content: I choose B by error. Correct one is A

discussion.content:
A
Strict: In this mode, Fortigate also verifies that the matching route is the best route in the routing table. That is, if the route in table contains a matching route for the source address and the incoming interface, but there is a better route for the source address through another interface the the rpf check fails.
A correct

choices.D: The matching firewall policy is set to proxy inspection mode
choices.C: The certificate used by FortiGate for SSL inspection does not contain the required certificate extensions.
choices.B: The browser does not trust the certificate used by FortiGate for SSL inspection
choices.A: The option invalid SSL certificates is set to allow on the SSL/SSH inspection profile

questions.question_text:
A network administrator has enabled full SSL inspection and web filtering on FortiGate. When visiting any HTTPS websites, the browser reports certificate warning errors. When visiting HTTP websites, the browser does not report errors.

What is the reason for the certificate warning errors?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Browser is not trusting the certificate used by fortigate, probably the self-signed certificate
B IS CORRECT
B correct

choices.A: Enable the parameter Never Timeout in the admin profiles
choices.C: Increase the admintimeout value under config system global
choices.D: Increase the offline value of the Override idle Timeout parameter in the NOC_Access admin profile
choices.B: Increase the admintimeout value under config system accprofile super_admin.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
FG ADM 7.4 
"You can override the idle timeout setting per administartor profile using the Override Idle Timeout setting. 
You can configure an administrator profile to increase inactivity timeout and facilitate use of the GUI for central monitoring. Then Override Idel Timeout setting allows the admintimeout value, under the config system accprofile, to be overridden per access profile."

Selected Answer: D
admintimeout non existant

comments.content: it exist, a default setting under config global

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It's D

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, there is no such setting as admintimeout value under admin profiles. The only two options are Never time out OR Offline value under Override idle timeout.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, Under system>Admin profiles we can set offline value of the Override Idle Timeout.
B is correct

comments.content: yes, admintimeout could set to override under admin profile.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D would be more correct than C . C changes the timeout for ALL admins, D would change it for just the NOC_Access profiles, and the question says "answer this specific request for NOC team". To me that means it's better to just change their setting in the GUI using option D
C correct

questions.question_text:
A network administrator enabled antivirus and selected an SSL inspection profile on a firewall policy.

When downloading an EICAR test file through HTTP, FortiGate detects the virus and blocks the file. When downloading the same file through HTTPS, FortiGate does not detect the and does not block the file allowing it to be downloaded.

The administrator confirms that the traffic matches the configured firewall policy.

What are two reasons for the failed virus detection by FortiGate? (Choose two.)

Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


Examine the intrusion prevention system (IPS) diagnostic command shown in the exhibit.

If option 5 is used with the IPS diagnostic command and the outcome is a decrease in the CPU usage, what is the correct conclusion?

choices.D: The IPS engine will continue to run in a normal state.
choices.C: The IPS engine is unable to prevent an intrusion attack.
choices.B: The IPS engine is inspecting a high volume of traffic.
choices.A: The IPS engine is blocking all traffic.

discussion.content: B correct

Selected Answer: B
If there are high-CPU use problems caused by the IPS, you can use the diagnose test application ipsmonitor command with option 5 to isolate where the problem might be. Option 5 enables IPS bypass
mode. In this mode, the IPS engine is still running, but it is not inspecting traffic. If the CPU use decreases after that, it usually indicates that the volume of traffic being inspected is too high for that FortiGate model.

Selected Answer: B
If the CPU use decreases after that, it usually indicates that the volume of traffic being inspected is too high for that FortiGate model

Selected Answer: B
It's B,

Selected Answer: B
B ,

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

comments.content: If the CPU use decreases after that, it usually indicates that the volume of traffic being inspected is too high for that FortiGate model.
